messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] spending time in the bathroom
messages.msgSnippet: I did too.  I used to stare at my eyes in the mirror and almost self-hypnotize myself.  I would
messages.messageBody:
<<I enjoyed spending time in the bathroom when I was a kid.>>

I did too. I used to stare at my eyes in the mirror and almost
self-hypnotize myself. I would think about the possibilities of alternate
realities...what if our big important world was really just a red blood cell
in a giant being? What if dreams were reality and reality was really just
dreams? Wierd stuff....but I knew nobody would interrrupt me in the
bathroom.

Julie S.
----- Original Message -----
From: <mc1mommy@...>
To: <UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Friday, January 02, 2004 11:02 AM
Subject: [UnschoolingDiscussion] spending time in the bathroom


>
>
> > << My kids can spend all the time in the bathroom they want now. >>
>
>
> Doing experiments.
> Mixing stuff to see what would happen. Perfume and powder doesn't do
much,
> but alka seltzer and iodine!!! And I used to do commecials for Avon in
the
> mirror, holding various products lovingly to my cheek, smiling
convincingly.
> Mary J
>
>
>

messages.subject: spending time in the bathroom
messages.msgSnippet: ... I enjoyed spending time in the bathroom when I was a kid.  Doing experiments. Mixing stuff to see what would happen.  Perfume and powder doesn t do much,
messages.messageBody:
> << My kids can spend all the time in the bathroom they want now. >>


I enjoyed spending time in the bathroom when I was a kid. Doing experiments.
Mixing stuff to see what would happen. Perfume and powder doesn't do much,
but alka seltzer and iodine!!! And I used to do commecials for Avon in the
mirror, holding various products lovingly to my cheek, smiling convincingly.
Mary J
